block.p: Sonia Ann Rai, a daughter of Lydia S. Rai and Dr. Lala L. Rai of the Bronx, is to be married today to Raymond Yee, a son of Yuen-Hing Yee of the Bronx and the late Jimmy Yee. Msgr. Robert Trainor is to perform the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Church of St. Anne, in the Bronx.

Ms. Rai, 34, will keep her name. She graduated summa cum laude from Lehman College, where she is a candidate for a master's degree in computer science and an adjunct instructor of accounting in the school of continuing education. Her father teaches mathematics at De Witt Clinton High School and is an adjunct professor of mathematics at Monroe College, both in the Bronx. Her mother retired as an assistant teacher at Tremont Day Care Center in the Bronx.

Sonia Ann Rai, a daughter of Lydia S. Rai and Dr. Lala L. Rai of the Bronx, is to be married today to Raymond Yee, a son of Yuen-Hing Yee of the Bronx and the late Jimmy Yee. Msgr. Robert Trainor is to perform the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Church of St. Anne, in the Bronx.

Ms. Rai, 34, will keep her name. She graduated summa cum laude from Lehman College, where she is a candidate for a master's degree in computer science and an adjunct instructor of accounting in the school of continuing education. Her father teaches mathematics at De Witt Clinton High School and is an adjunct professor of mathematics at Monroe College, both in the Bronx. Her mother retired as an assistant teacher at Tremont Day Care Center in the Bronx.

Mr. Yee, 40, is an assistant director of data analysis and reporting at the Contract Management Organization, a managed-health-care company in Yonkers. He graduated from Columbia University and received a master's degree in public health from Columbia and an M.B.A. from New York University. His father owned restaurants in Manhattan and New Rochelle, N.Y. The bridegroom's mother is a retired seamstress.
